programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: The Big Sick
I tak cię kocham
The Big Sick
programme.desc:
The Big Sick: Directed by Michael Showalter. With Kumail Nanjiani, Zoe Kazan, Holly Hunter, Ray Romano. Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's expectations, and his true feelings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5462602/","name":"The Big Sick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWM4YzZjOTEtZmU5ZS00ZTRkLWFiNjAtZTEwNzIzMDM5MjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg2MjUxNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5462602/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1"},"dateCreated":"2017-07-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Big Winner!","reviewBody":"'The Big Sick' is pure cinematic bliss. This Heartwarming True-Story is told in a Unadultrated, Simple & Emotionally Empowering way, that leaves you wanting for more. 

'The Big Sick' is based on the real courtship of Kumail Nanjiani and his now-wife, Emily Gordon. Kumail's traditional Pakistani Muslim family is unhappy with his relationship with Emily, a White American. When Emily is waylaid by a mysterious illness, Kumail must take charge of the crisis with her parents, Beth and Terry, whom he barely knows.

'The Big Sick' is an overwhelming experience, that left me with a big smile on my face. Its beautiful love-story, with the backdrop of two diverse families, from two extreme ends of the world. Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon re-tell their heartwarming, albeit intense journey, with pure skill. The two successfully capture their real life experiences & nurture into a terrific cinematic experience. The Writing is top-notch & offers a realistic take on different religions, without ever taking sides. Such Writing deserves an Oscar Nomination. Michael Showalter's Direction is simplistic, yet wonderful. Cinematography & Editing are effectively done. Art & Costume Design are perfect. 

Performance-Wise: Kumail Nanjiani is wonderfully restrained, delivering a performance driven by pure feeling. Zoe Kazan as Emily, is extraordinary. Although she gets limited screen time in comparison to the others, the actress leaves a solid mark. Ray Romano & Holly Hunter, as Emily's parents, are flawless. What Performers! Anupam Kher as Kumail's Father & Adeel Akhtar's as Kumail's brother, are excellent. Bo Burnham & Kurt Braunohler shine as Kumail's fellow stand-up mates. Others lend support.

On the whole, 'The Big Sick' is an Unmissable Gem. Two Big Thumbs Up!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128324,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2017-07-14","keywords":"interracial love,arranged marriage,stand up comedy,illness,family relationships","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3014637849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdjN2ZlNjktZGNmZi00NjY5LTgzZDYtNjRmYjFhODcwZThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU4NjY5MzM@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdjN2ZlNjktZGNmZi00NjY5LTgzZDYtNjRmYjFhODcwZThlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTU4NjY5MzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple deals with their cultural differences as their relationship grows."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3529685/","name":"Kumail Nanjiani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1443740/","name":"Zoe Kazan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000456/","name":"Holly Hunter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0795290/","name":"Michael Showalter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0462648/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5077137/","name":"Emily V. Gordon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3529685/","name":"Kumail Nanjiani"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's expectations, and his true feelings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5462602/","name":"The Big Sick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWM4YzZjOTEtZmU5ZS00ZTRkLWFiNjAtZTEwNzIzMDM5MjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg2MjUxNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5462602/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1","dateCreated":"2017-07-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Big Winner!","reviewBody":"'The Big Sick' is pure cinematic bliss. This Heartwarming True-Story is told in a Unadultrated, Simple & Emotionally Empowering way, that leaves you wanting for more. 

'The Big Sick' is based on the real courtship of Kumail Nanjiani and his now-wife, Emily Gordon. Kumail's traditional Pakistani Muslim family is unhappy with his relationship with Emily, a White American. When Emily is waylaid by a mysterious illness, Kumail must take charge of the crisis with her parents, Beth and Terry, whom he barely knows.

'The Big Sick' is an overwhelming experience, that left me with a big smile on my face. Its beautiful love-story, with the backdrop of two diverse families, from two extreme ends of the world. Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon re-tell their heartwarming, albeit intense journey, with pure skill. The two successfully capture their real life experiences & nurture into a terrific cinematic experience. The Writing is top-notch & offers a realistic take on different religions, without ever taking sides. Such Writing deserves an Oscar Nomination. Michael Showalter's Direction is simplistic, yet wonderful. Cinematography & Editing are effectively done. Art & Costume Design are perfect. 

Performance-Wise: Kumail Nanjiani is wonderfully restrained, delivering a performance driven by pure feeling. Zoe Kazan as Emily, is extraordinary. Although she gets limited screen time in comparison to the others, the actress leaves a solid mark. Ray Romano & Holly Hunter, as Emily's parents, are flawless. What Performers! Anupam Kher as Kumail's Father & Adeel Akhtar's as Kumail's brother, are excellent. Bo Burnham & Kurt Braunohler shine as Kumail's fellow stand-up mates. Others lend support.

On the whole, 'The Big Sick' is an Unmissable Gem. programme.title: Rykoszety
Rykoszety
programme.desc: Rykoszety: Directed by Jakub Radej. With Stanislaw Linowski, Zuzanna Zielinska, Tomasz Schuchardt, Marta Scislowicz. Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. Two coal miner brothers react differently to the oppressive police state. While Tadek prefers to retreat into neutrality, Janek chooses active engagement in the democratic underground. When Janek asks Tadek to store some anti-government leaflets on the second anniversary of Solidarity's 1980 strikes, he triggers a spiral of events that will have everyone's allegiances and characters severely tested." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8658144/","name":"Rykoszety","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc0ZGJlOTUtYWM5NS00MjY3LWE5YzYtNWQxMjYyNDU5NjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. programme.title: Sole
Sole
programme.desc: Sole: Directed by Carlo Sironi. With Claudio Segaluscio, Sandra Drzymalska, Bruno Buzzi, Marco Felli. Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. Ermanno agrees to pretend to be the father. Fabio, the uncle of Ermanno, will pay them to buy the child that he and his wife Bianca cannot have. A fake adoption between relatives, a loophole to bypass the law cause in Italy the surrogate motherhood is forbidden. A world in which money is the only standard of value, the only thing that matter. Ermanno and Lena are two strangers that must pretend in public to be a couple and live together until the delivery. They are used to only think about themselves and they fight all the time. But living side by side they start becoming what they were only pretending to be." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648994/","name":"Sole","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjI2YjUtMzAyOS00YWViLWJiY2UtYzcwZTliYjk5YTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzMxMDgxNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. programme.title: Ratujmy zakład
Pollux
programme.desc: 13-letni Vivian (Vivian Oudin) oraz Max (Maximilien Decorse) nie mogą jechać na tegoroczny obóz letni ze względu na rychłe zamknięcie fabryki, w której pracują ich rodzice. Rodzeństwo oraz ich przyjaciel z dzieciństwa, Tom (Tom-Eliott Fosse-Taurel), wpadają na pomysł, jak zarobić potrzebne pieniądze i miło spędzić wakacje. Pozostało im jednak niewiele czasu na zrealizowanie swojego planu.

Psycholka
Psychobitch
programme.desc: Psychobitch: Directed by Martin Lund. With Jonas Tidemann, Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne, Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen, Bethina Nærby. Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8360266/","name":"Psychobitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdiYzc2ZjctOWNiNS00OWQ2LWE4ZjktNmY4YjVmZGE5N2RhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nairtejas"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"12th BIFFES Review: Psychobitch / Palpable High School Romance / 6 Stars","reviewBody":"Psychobitch is one of those high school romance stories that aspires to be socially relevant by exploring mental illness and manages to do that to some extent. However, the forced wickedness that one finds in the characters of Frida and Marius make the drama look like it was concocted just to make that point. But, it is still fun to watch as these characters fool around together in a brutal high school setting where making fun of each other and gossiping is the average order. There are a few palpable sequences (some funny, some serious) that you will take away from Psychobitch but anything more than that will be a stretch. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nairtejas","dateCreated":"2020-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"12th BIFFES Review: Psychobitch / Palpable High School Romance / 6 Stars","reviewBody":"Psychobitch is one of those high school romance stories that aspires to be socially relevant by exploring mental illness and manages to do that to some extent. However, the forced wickedness that one finds in the characters of Frida and Marius make the drama look like it was concocted just to make that point. But, it is still fun to watch as these characters fool around together in a brutal high school setting where making fun of each other and gossiping is the average order. There are a few palpable sequences (some funny, some serious) that you will take away from Psychobitch but anything more than that will be a stretch. TN.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":824,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-11","keywords":"one word title,teenage boy,teenage girl,coming of age,small town","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6638989/","name":"Jonas Tidemann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9602953/","name":"Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9811535/","name":"Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291647/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0780832/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054056/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lantana
Kwestia zaufania
Lantana
programme.desc:
Lantana: Directed by Ray Lawrence. With Anthony LaPaglia, Rachael Blake, Kerry Armstrong, Manu Bennett. The relationships of four couples unravel after the discovery of a young woman's body in Lantana bush in suburban Sydney." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0259393/","name":"Lantana","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2UwZGJjODAtYmY3OC00NzZmLTgyMzAtMDlkMWMzNjM1MjRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ5MzY0NjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationships of four couples unravel after the discovery of a young woman's body in Lantana bush in suburban Sydney.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0259393/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"samelsby"},"dateCreated":"2005-05-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Australian cinema, but not as we know it.","reviewBody":"Most successful Australian films are quintessentially Australian. From Walkabout in 1970 via Peter Weir's pictures such as Picnic at Hanging Rock; The Last Wave and Gallipoli, right up to releases around Lantana such as The Tracker; Dirty Deeds; Rabbit-Proof Fence; Aussie Rules; The Dish and the Steve Irwin vehicle, The Crocodile Hunter Collision Course. Their appeal is partly based on an exploration of Australian culture or rather a contrast of cultures either within Australia or with the rest of the world. Like much of British Cinema, Australian Cinema has taken refuge in nationhood.

Lantana is different. Although it is set in present day Sydney it could, with the exception of the film's metaphorical title, be set in any Western urban conurbation. The film does not depend on either supposed Aussie character traits or well-known locations. Postcard Sydney is eschewed in favour of suburbia and mid-town. It is also bold as, although it contains a crime detection story, the film is primarily about an interwoven set of relationships gone wrong. The police investigation does not begin until halfway through the film, and this allows the relationships to be explored in detail before the more conventional narrative begins. 

Leon (Anthony LaPaglia) is a morose police detective whose marriage to Sonja (the excellent Kerry Armstrong) is failing. His brief affair with Jane (Rachael Blake) in the opening sequence, is a symptom not a cause. Sonja confides her worries of the affair to Dr. Somers (Barbara Hershey), whose own relationship is soured by suspicion and tragedy. The only solid relationship is that of Jane's neighbours, whose domestic circumstances are the most difficult. This background unfolds in the first half of the film and the individual relationships are then laid over the plot allowing both an intertwining and explanation. The strength of the film is that as the characters have already been well realised, so their actions and emotions can be understood in the second half of the film. This is territory often reserved to a good novel, and is rarely brought off in the cinema and it is so well done here that a couple of narrative co-incidences can be forgiven.

The lantana is a large native Australian flowering plant, whose attractive and benign appearance conceals a thorny interior. The shrub is cleverly threaded into the plot and serves as a reminder that in relationships, things might not be all they seem and that care is needed to prevent hurt. In keeping with the film's realistic style there are no feel-good resolutions but the emotional intensity carries it to an ending of some hope rather than desolation.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19137,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-10-04","keywords":"rear entry sex,adulterous wife,lust,scantily clad female,nylons","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Lantana","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi328335641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTlkN2ViN2EtM2EzMS00MTFlLThhMGMtYzc0OWVkZmY4YjZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTlkN2ViN2EtM2EzMS00MTFlLThhMGMtYzc0OWVkZmY4YjZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Th trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001439/","name":"Anthony LaPaglia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001691/","name":"Geoffrey Rush"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0086697/","name":"Rachael Blake"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492979/","name":"Ray Lawrence"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005370/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000915/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023514/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0100597/","name":"Andrew Bovell"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Trials of Cate McCall
Niesłusznie oskarżona
The Trials of Cate McCall
programme.desc:
The Trials of Cate McCall: Directed by Karen Moncrieff. With Kate Beckinsale, Nick Nolte, James Cromwell, Mark Pellegrino. In order to be reinstated to the bar and recover custody of her daughter, a hotshot lawyer, now in recovery and on probation, must take on the appeal of a woman wrongfully convicted of murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1323973/","name":"The Trials of Cate McCall","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTUwNjI4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTk4MDk3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In order to be reinstated to the bar and recover custody of her daughter, a hotshot lawyer, now in recovery and on probation, must take on the appeal of a woman wrongfully convicted of murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1323973/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"larrys3"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kate Beckinsale is Captivating","reviewBody":"I thought this film was fairly engrossing and intriguing, but was marred somewhat by contrivances and some non-believable plot elements.

Kate Beckinsale is quite captivating as Cate McCall, once a hot-shot and high priced attorney, but who has now been put on probation for alcohol and drug abuse. Part of her probation requires her to attend AA meetings, while another part calls for her to work pro bono for a Legal Aid type organization.

She's given the appeals case of a young woman convicted of first degree murder and serving a life without parole sentence. Cate soon begins to unravel evidence that may show that her client was framed and may indeed be innocent.

As the movie title suggests, Cate's trials are not all in the courtroom as she's struggling to gain sobriety from her addictions, as well as attempting to prevent her estranged husband from taking their young daughter to Seattle, for his new job. Additionally, a man she may have over zealously prosecuted, when she was with the DA's office years before, and who has recently be released from jail and declared innocent (after DNA testing), may be trying to stalk her.

The supporting cast is very strong here, with the great veteran actor Nick Nolte portraying Bridges, himself a defense attorney in recovery and helping Cate as her AA sponsor. Another terrific veteran actor James Cromwell plays Federal judge Jason Sumpter, whose bent for womanizing appears to be affecting his judicial decisions. Finally, Anna Anissimova is chilling and effective as Lacey Stubbs, the woman whose murder appeals' case is being handled by Cate.

I might mention there is no on screen showing of violence or sex here, but there is graphic and explicit testimony describing the above that is read during the movie.

Overall this film written and directed by Karen Moncrieff (The Dead Girl, Blue Car), as mentioned, was marred somewhat by nonsensical plot elements, but I still remained engaged throughout, and I would say it is worth a watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5959,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-11-28","keywords":"lawyer,rehab,alcoholic,f rated,cigarette smoking","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Trials of Cate McCall","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi584035609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhmMTM2MTYtODQwYi00NzhmLTgzZWUtZTBhNjAzZTJkNDMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhmMTM2MTYtODQwYi00NzhmLTgzZWUtZTBhNjAzZTJkNDMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Trials of Cate McCall"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000295/","name":"Kate Beckinsale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000342/","name":"James Cromwell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0597673/","name":"Karen Moncrieff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0294391/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176286/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0276464/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0597673/","name":"Karen Moncrieff"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Szczescie swiata
Szczęście świata
programme.desc:
Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6104188, Title: Szczescie swiata, --- Description: Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125","dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

programme.desc: W tunezyjskiej wiosce dzieci grają w piłkę nożną na pustkowiach. Tymczasem Abdallah (Mohamed Ali) i Mohamed (Eltayef Dhaoui) spotykają osła ze słuchawkami na uszach i torbami pełnymi białego proszku na plecach. Dwaj młodzi bracia postanawiają przynieść bagaż do swojej wioski.

programme.title: Kiler
Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. programme.title: Das Vorspiel
Przesłuchanie
Das Vorspiel
programme.desc: Das Vorspiel: Directed by Ina Weisse. With Nina Hoss, Sophie Rois, Thorsten Merten, Franziska Fauth. Anna Bronsky is a violin teacher at the Conservatoire. Against the advice of her colleagues, she imposes the admission of a pupil, in whom she sees a great talent. With a lot of involvement, she prepares Alexander for the end-of-year exam and neglects her young son Jonas, who is also a violinist and ice hockey fan. She moves away more and more from her husband, so fond of him, the French "luthier" Philippe Bronsky. At the approach of audition, Anna pushes Alexander towards performances more and more exceptional. The decisive day, an accident occurs, heavy consequence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8620154/","name":"Das Vorspiel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjRkNDgzNmItYzAwZC00ZWE4LTliZjUtM2MyNGU2ODBhYjhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTQwMDA5NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Anna Bronsky is a violin teacher at the Conservatoire. programme.title: Home Invasion
Niebezpieczni intruzi
Home Invasion
programme.desc: Home Invasion: Directed by David Tennant. With Jason Patric, Scott Adkins, Natasha Henstridge, William Dickinson. Intruders shoot Chloe's friend and break into Chloe's home on an isolated island on a rainy night. Can the high tech security company help Chloe and her stepson?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5351000/","name":"Home Invasion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzY3NzE4NTMxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMwNjk4NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intruders shoot Chloe's friend and break into Chloe's home on an isolated island on a rainy night. Can the high tech security company help Chloe and her stepson?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5351000/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"manuelasaez"},"dateCreated":"2016-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Made for TV quality with no redeemable qualities.","reviewBody":"I love home invasion movies. They are often brutal, violent, and show the ugly side of one of the worst crimes a family can experience. This movie, however, was so tame as to make the actual act as boring as having neighbors you dislike over for tea. The script with asinine, the acting was atrocious, and the lack of any violence, blood, or foul-language was bad enough, but this is supposed to instill horror and dread on the viewer, and I was simply BORED. Bored from beginning to end at this failure of a film, and it does not deserve to be seen by even the most prudish fan of cinema. It is a Home Invasion film for religious people, in that there is nothing to suggest that the movie is actually aiming to show the horror of home invasions. It is a really bad joke that fails from its inception to its punchline. And the ending? Sweet Mary, that ending! What a load of freaking hot garbage. All of it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3480,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2016-02-02","keywords":"home invasion,low budget,tied feet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Home Invasion","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi328381721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmM2ZmY0M2EtZWQyMy00NDI1LWJlYTAtZmFhMzNjOTk5NGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmM2ZmY0M2EtZWQyMy00NDI1LWJlYTAtZmFhMzNjOTk5NGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Home Invasion"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000574/","name":"Jason Patric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012078/","name":"Scott Adkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000449/","name":"Natasha Henstridge"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0855040/","name":"David Tennant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0246372/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319737/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0379077/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838289/","name":"Peter Sullivan"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Rise of the Zombies: Directed by Nick Lyon. With Mariel Hemingway, Ethan Suplee, LeVar Burton, Danny Trejo. programme.title: Dark Storm

Dark Storm
programme.desc:
Dark Storm: Directed by Jason Bourque. With Stephen Baldwin, Rob LaBelle, Gardiner Millar, Camille Sullivan. Racing against time and greedy weapons dealers, a group of scientists led by Dr Gray must stop the Dark Matter discovery they made from destroying the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0758740/","name":"Dark Storm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTJjZWJiMmUtNzRiMS00MmRlLWFlMjItNmMzNzI1ODgwZGI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Racing against time and greedy weapons dealers, a group of scientists led by Dr Gray must stop the Dark Matter discovery they made from destroying the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0758740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"themoge"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awful, just awful","reviewBody":"I had to stay up with my young son last night and thought Dark Storm looked vaguely interesting compared to the other pap on offer. 

No. 

It was the aura of car crash TV that kept me watching. A fat Stephen Baldwin acting worse than my armchair does. My word, I've never seen anyone so bad in a film. 

His scientist sidekick and the villain at least were professional and I could believe they were actors, but Mr. Baldwin gave the standout worst "acting performance" I have ever had the misfortune of sitting in front of. Whatever you do, do not waste an hour or two of your precious life on this utter shower of *&^%. Spend the time more fruitfully in staring at a blank wall, or cutting your toenails.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":898,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-06-15","keywords":"seattle space needle,disaster film,disaster movie,scientist,dark matter","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dark Storm","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3231711513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFkZjRmYzYtOTBmZC00MzZmLWJlZDgtZTllMGExNmQzNzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFkZjRmYzYtOTBmZC00MzZmLWJlZDgtZTllMGExNmQzNzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Lionsgate"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000286/","name":"Stephen Baldwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005588/","name":"Rob LaBelle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0587667/","name":"Gardiner Millar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1028302/","name":"Jason Bourque"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086887/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180212/","name":"Sean Malcolm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0773732/","name":"Brett Schneider"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2185370/","name":"John Cherfer"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Beautiful Country
Kraina szczęścia
The Beautiful Country
programme.desc: The Beautiful Country: Directed by Hans Petter Moland. With Damien Nguyen, Bai Ling, Thi Hoa Mai, Nick Nolte. After reuniting with his mother in Ho Chi Minh City, a family tragedy causes Binh to flee from Viet Nam to America. Landing in New York, Binh begins a road trip to Texas, where his American father is said to live." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0273108/","name":"The Beautiful Country","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWEwNTI4YzAtOWI0NS00ZGE0LWI4NTAtMDdhNzZkODBiNGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After reuniting with his mother in Ho Chi Minh City, a family tragedy causes Binh to flee from Viet Nam to America. Landing in New York, Binh begins a road trip to Texas, where his American father is said to live.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0273108/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jdpyke"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great movie, yet underrated","reviewBody":"Classic tale of redemption, brimming with drama and a lead character that says little, but who you quickly relate to and associate yourself with. Starts of kind of slow, but after 15-20 minutes, the movie picks up and never slows down, with high drama and classic storytelling. A must-see. The movie is set to the backdrop of the aftermath of the Vietnam war in Vietnam, and portrays the poverty-stricken environment they are forced to live in. It then moves on to show the desperation of would-be American immigrants fleeing from one land that doesn't want them to sneak into another. After watching this movie, you will definitely have a greater appreciation for what some immigrants have to go through.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3842,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2004-03-13","keywords":"united states,searching for father,texas,saigon,new york city","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Beautiful Country","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1924727065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3ZTI1NmYtYmEwNy00ZWJkLTk2NzYtNTFmODU1ZGJhY2JhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3ZTI1NmYtYmEwNy00ZWJkLTk2NzYtNTFmODU1ZGJhY2JhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1280613/","name":"Damien Nguyen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000499/","name":"Bai Ling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1336006/","name":"Dang Quoc Thinh Tran"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596407/","name":"Hans Petter Moland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010666/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041459/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113606/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1182012/","name":"Sabina Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1600857/","name":"Lingard Jervey"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fire Twister
Ogniste tornado
Fire Twister
programme.desc: Fire Twister: Directed by George Erschbamer. With Casper Van Dien, Lisa Davis, Johnny Hawkes, Leah Bateman. A man-made fire twister sweeps through Los Angeles, leaving the city in ruins. However, all is not lost when a group of strangers band together to put an end to the destruction." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3350436/","name":"Fire Twister","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzExNDY0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAzNzMwODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man-made fire twister sweeps through Los Angeles, leaving the city in ruins. However, all is not lost when a group of strangers band together to put an end to the destruction.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3350436/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Leofwine_draca"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"With that title, you know just what you're in for","reviewBody":"Another in an endless stream of cheap disaster movies filled with washed-up leading actors, nobody supporting actors, and lousy CGI. This one's got Casper Van Dien in it - no stranger to the genre having also appeared in 500 MPH STORM, which is pretty much interchangeable with this movie. The story is about a private company who devise a new and deadly form of fuel, which then gets caught up in a twister and refuses to be extinguished.\n\nAs with so many of these films, almost the entire running time consists of a central family who find themselves caught up in an almost sentient disaster which then proceeds to chase them all over the country. Shots of the fire twister chasing a jeep must take up at least half of the running time. The acting is wooden, the characters are made of cardboard, and the movie exudes cheapness from every poor. I love the over the top nature of the evil company which sends a machine-gun toting hit squad after any witnesses to this man-made catastrophe; totally over the top and cheesy with it. The only positive I can find to say about FIRE TWISTER is that the CGI effects aren't quite as terrible as is the norm for this genre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-06-21","keywords":"disaster film,fugitive,hitman,sniper,tornado","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fire Twister","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3334520601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkYjg3NjAtNmI3Ny00MmJlLWJhMjUtYmU0MTNkYWE5ZTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkYjg3NjAtNmI3Ny00MmJlLWJhMjUtYmU0MTNkYWE5ZTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000680/","name":"Casper Van Dien"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2451535/","name":"Lisa Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1027228/","name":"Johnny Hawkes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0259821/","name":"George Erschbamer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319737/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0326282/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0047717/","name":"Larry Bain"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Agent of Influence
Agent wpływu
Agent of Influence
programme.desc: Agent of Influence: Directed by Michel Poulette. With Christopher Plummer, Marina Orsini, Ted Whittall, Shaun Johnston. From Ian Adams' book of the same name, "Agent of Influence" is based on a real story of the intrigue surrounding the mysterious death of one of Canada's most accomplished foreign diplomats, John Watkins." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307934/","name":"Agent of Influence","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM2ZDMwYTgtNmM5Mi00NWI5LWExOTQtMzQ0YjI0YTA2ZDliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk5MjAyMjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"From Ian Adams' book of the same name, "Agent of Influence" is based on a real story of the intrigue surrounding the mysterious death of one of Canada's most accomplished foreign diplomats, John Watkins.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0307934/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Uriah43"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Ambassador in a Compromised Position","reviewBody":"Loosely based on a true story, this film revolves around a man by the name of "John Watkins" (Christopher Plummer) who was a close and trusted friend of the Canadian Prime Minister. As such, he was given a position as the ambassador to the Soviet Union and from all accounts performed quite well. However, when some compromising information became available that implicated him in a possible blackmail scheme by the Soviets for a homosexual affair, he was quickly apprehended by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and interrogated. What follows in this film is a possible narrative of the events during his interrogation which have certain sinister overtones that may-or may not-be credible. Now, rather than reveal any more and risk potentially ruining the film for those who haven't seen it, I will just say that after reading the account of this incident it is quite possible that the events depicted in this movie are somewhat embellished to provide for a better story than would have been obtained otherwise. Regardless, as far as this picture is concerned, there really wasn't that much action or suspense but Christopher Plummer performed adequately enough to maintain my interest for the most part and because of that I have rated this film accordingly. Average.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":321,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"keywords":"cia central intelligence agency,cold war,espionage,canadian soviet relations,canadian russian relations","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001626/","name":"Christopher Plummer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650739/","name":"Marina Orsini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926471/","name":"Ted Whittall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693599/","name":"Michel Poulette"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0231796/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005842/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160942/","name":"Ken Chubb"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011021/","name":"Ian Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1135065/","name":"Riley Adams"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Aces 'N' Eights
Zabójcza rozgrywka
Aces 'N Eights
programme.desc:
Aces 'N' Eights: Directed by Craig R. Baxley. With Casper Van Dien, Bruce Boxleitner, Ernest Borgnine, Jeff Kober. Already taking a gamble settling in the uncharted west, the peaceful settlers of a town destined for railroad greatness suddenly find themselves being ruthlessly gunned down. With no law and order to be found, justice falls onto the shoulders of an elderly rancher and an accomplished, but retired, gunslinger." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1087828/","name":"Aces 'N' Eights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMzAyNjQxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzE2MTIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Already taking a gamble settling in the uncharted west, the peaceful settlers of a town destined for railroad greatness suddenly find themselves being ruthlessly gunned down. With no law and order to be found, justice falls onto the ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1087828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vitaleralphlouis"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Startlingly Stupid Western Disappoints!","reviewBody":"We love westerns and wish there were more of them; but this one was made by people who lack the good sense of a goat.

The story has been told a hundred times about the brave ranchers and settlers trying to hold out against an abusive takeover of their land at unfair compensation. Almost all previous movies were better than this sorry mess. The story is absolutely ruined by the emptyheadedness of today's talent-free film-makers -- who refuse to learn anything from the greats of yesteryear.

To begin with, the picture substitutes excessive violence in place of a good story. The story is actually a muddled mess at best. They use all of the born-stupid techniques that spoil so many recent pictures: bad photography, dreadful editing, wrong-headed camera shots, and one of the new computer-generated musical scores that never ceases to annoy -- and never lets up. Music is supposed to enhance the action, not detract from it.

If you love westerns, skip this stinker. Perhaps Genius Pictures which made it will fade away.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":738,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-03-15","keywords":"rancher,railroad,main character shot,torture,opening action scene","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Aces 'N Eights","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi179634457","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MzYwODYtZGJkMi00NGQ3LWI3NTAtZTJmNjc0ZDlhOTYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MzYwODYtZGJkMi00NGQ3LWI3NTAtZTJmNjc0ZDlhOTYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Grand Army"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000680/","name":"Casper Van Dien"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000310/","name":"Bruce Boxleitner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000308/","name":"Ernest Borgnine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0062644/","name":"Craig R. With no law and order to be found, justice falls onto the ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1087828/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"vitaleralphlouis","dateCreated":"2008-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Startlingly Stupid Western Disappoints!","reviewBody":"We love westerns and wish there were more of them; but this one was made by people who lack the good sense of a goat.

The story has been told a hundred times about the brave ranchers and settlers trying to hold out against an abusive takeover of their land at unfair compensation. Almost all previous movies were better than this sorry mess. The story is absolutely ruined by the emptyheadedness of today's talent-free film-makers -- who refuse to learn anything from the greats of yesteryear.

To begin with, the picture substitutes excessive violence in place of a good story. The story is actually a muddled mess at best. They use all of the born-stupid techniques that spoil so many recent pictures: bad photography, dreadful editing, wrong-headed camera shots, and one of the new computer-generated musical scores that never ceases to annoy -- and never lets up. Music is supposed to enhance the action, not detract from it.

If you love westerns, skip this stinker. programme.desc:
Twin Daggers: Directed by Kun-Hou Chen. With Rhett Giles, Coco Su, Veronica Bero, Joey Covington. A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1266149/","name":"Twin Daggers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MDU4NDE2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzE3MjA2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A famous L.A. hitman falls in love with his target.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1266149/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"verseczy"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Perhaps Richard Roeper's Kind Of Martial Arts Movie","reviewBody":"Warning all martial arts movie fans: Don't watch this! I wish there was a review or a clue to prevent me from renting this atrocity. I promised myself, I will not rate any movie with 1 out of 10, simply because somebody put time and effort into realization of such, and that alone deserves rating 2.

However how can you justify so much standing, sitting, dancing around in any movie let alone in martial arts or self proclaimed action film. Add to that: horrific acting, stupid script, terrible sound, fight scenes so hilarious for a good while I thought I'm watching a spoof, and editing at accelerated speed to cover up protagonists clumsiness in fighting skills. If they were to use any famous doubles you wouldn't had have hard time to recognize them at all.

I can only recommend this movie to Richard Roeper on the fact that he gave Ong Bak a thumb down in Ebert & Roeper at the Movies with reasoning that there was only 7 minutes of plot in excess to action. Well, Happy Birthday Richard, here is THE movie for you: Twin Daggers! All you can consume buffet of fable, followed by lengthy abeyance, to finish off with just a dash of engagement.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":296,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2008-07-22","keywords":"hitman,violence,martial arts","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065316/","name":"Rhett Giles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3080460/","name":"Coco Su"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157242/","name":"Veronica Bero"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155292/","name":"Kun-Hou Chen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078389/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065443/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0139852/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11888805/","name":"Allen Shan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: First Blood
Rambo: Pierwsza krew
First Blood
programme.desc: First Blood: Directed by Ted Kotcheff. With Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Brian Dennehy, Bill McKinney. A veteran Green Beret is forced by a cruel Sheriff and his deputies to flee into the mountains and wage an escalating one-man war against his pursuers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0083944/","name":"First Blood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODBmOWU2YWMtZGUzZi00YzRhLWJjNDAtYTUwNWVkNDcyZmU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A veteran Green Beret is forced by a cruel Sheriff and his deputies to flee into the mountains and wage an escalating one-man war against his pursuers.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0083944/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CalRhys"},"dateCreated":"2014-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Mesmerising Action Masterpiece","reviewBody":"The ultimate action film and the ultimate psychological thriller! 'First Blood' was among others like 'Die Hard' as being one of the first action films I saw when I was younger, I even owned it on VHS. This film has Sly showing off his acting ability (which is saying something for an actor with such little capability of "acting") as the iconic John Rambo in the film that sparked off the eponymous film franchise, whilst the sequels were heavily classified as flops, 'First Blood' is a daring and thrilling survival adventure that follows a Vietnam Vet and the post-war trauma he suffers from. A dark yet sensitive film that follows one of the great action stars as he fights to survive, a mesmerising action masterpiece."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":238724,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure"],"datePublished":"1982-10-22","keywords":"abuse of power,corrupt sheriff,veteran,corrupt cop,bad cop","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rambo: First Blood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1402863897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2JkY2FhOTgtODAzZi00YzUyLTk5ZWMtODZiNTM0YWI2MDhlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2JkY2FhOTgtODAzZi00YzUyLTk5ZWMtODZiNTM0YWI2MDhlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001133/","name":"Brian Dennehy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001077/","name":"Richard Crenna"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467646/","name":"Ted Kotcheff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055376/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0779514/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0231747/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0606251/","name":"David Morrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468997/","name":"Michael Kozoll"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0755266/","name":"William Sackheim"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sensored
Sensored
programme.desc: Sensored: Directed by Ryan Todd. With Robert Picardo, Sarah Knowlton, Brian Rife, Michelle Page. A children's book illustrator inhabits a twilight world of shifting reality and illusion, where cruelty and rampant evil do battle with his better instincts, and sanity is a question of perception." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1204966/","name":"Sensored","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NjAzNDA4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDY4NTE3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A children's book illustrator inhabits a twilight world of shifting reality and illusion, where cruelty and rampant evil do battle with his better instincts, and sanity is a question of perception.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1204966/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Leofwine_draca"},"dateCreated":"2016-02-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"It had potential, but it goes nowhere","reviewBody":"What an uneventful little film this was. I admit that the plot description makes it sound interesting, but in execution it's just yet another 'torture porn' spin-off from either SAW or HOSTEL, featuring people being tied up and tortured by a psycho. You have to feel for former STAR TREK actor Robert Picardo, being caught up in such a cheap and uneventful movie.\n\nI do enjoy B-movies as long as they're interesting, but SENSORED never is. The whole story is told in flashback with a twist or two that will be obvious from the outset. It's dim, murky, and exceptionally non-entertaining, with half the soundtrack just consisting of people screaming throughout. You just don't care about the characters despite the twists and turns of the plotting, which makes this a chore to sit through.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"keywords":"woman in jeopardy,water torture,black panties,black bra,torture","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000585/","name":"Robert Picardo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461587/","name":"Sarah Knowlton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2033389/","name":"Brian Rife"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1669506/","name":"Ryan Todd"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0151107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0281678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1905331/","name":"Kevin Haskin"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Quiet
W ciszy
The Quiet
programme.desc: The Quiet: Directed by Jamie Babbit. With Elisha Cuthbert, Camilla Belle, Edie Falco, Martin Donovan. Following the unexpected death of her father, a deaf teenager moves in with her godparents, where she discovers the cruel behaviour of their daughter may be indicative of a dark secret within the family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0414951/","name":"The Quiet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NDA4NDIyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDM5OTQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Following the unexpected death of her father, a deaf teenager moves in with her godparents, where she discovers the cruel behaviour of their daughter may be indicative of a dark secret within the family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0414951/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trev89"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Offbeat Award","reviewBody":"This film is very different from everything else out there, which is one reason why it has gotten so much attention here on IMDb. Some love it, some hate it, just like every movie. The subject matter is not the most appealing to the public, but I think that it gives the movie character. Looking back I can see many of the things that should have been changed, but the movie is a break out. A different type of movie, it is so different than everything else out there. It is original, and out-there.\n\nWhen watching this film you MUST be open-minded. Do not look at any of the negative reviews and watch the movie fresh of mind. If you know everything that is going to happen it makes it less entertaining too. If you have no clue what the movie was about I think it also gives it that much more of a sharper edge.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-09-12","keywords":"blonde,topless female nudity,voyeur,voyeurism,dysfunctional family","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Quiet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi452526361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjE2MGU0NWItYjk2MS00OGE1LWJhOGEtMWUxNDcyNzUwZjc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjE2MGU0NWItYjk2MS00OGE1LWJhOGEtMWUxNDcyNzUwZjc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004741/","name":"Camilla Belle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193846/","name":"Elisha Cuthbert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004908/","name":"Edie Falco"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044803/","name":"Jamie Babbit"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186897/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126219/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186711/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1459623/","name":"Abdi Nazemian"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1460116/","name":"Micah Schraft"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pit Fighter
Niepokonany
Pit Fighter
programme.desc:
Pit Fighter: Directed by Jesse V. Johnson. With Dominiquie Vandenberg, Steven Bauer, Fernando Carrillo, Stephen Graham. Jack Severino has no memory, all he knows is the brutal sport of Pit Fighting. When his past catches him up, he realizes he is not who he thought he was. For some men must fight for redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0396096/","name":"Pit Fighter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI4MWYwODAtMWE3MS00ZDg3LWEyM2ItNmYxZGU0MGM2YTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Severino has no memory, all he knows is the brutal sport of Pit Fighting. When his past catches him up, he realizes he is not who he thought he was. For some men must fight for redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0396096/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adrenokrome"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Redemption through violence...","reviewBody":"There is so much to this movie it's difficult to know where to begin. Being a martial arts freak, I had been following this film through its production stages and I was not disappointed with the end result.

The story is a tale of one mans redemption through violence. It is here where the fun begins  the fight scenes are kept to a more real approach opposed to going for the wire work ballet found in a huge back catalogue of hong kong flicks and many recent Hollywood outings. Favouring a more UFC/ K-1 approach, the fights have a gritty edge and the hero played by an enigmatic 'Dominique Vandenberg' who demonstrates a legit martial arts prowess! Vandenberg plays it very cool as Jack Severino/ El Yanqui and Steven Bauer puts in a very respectable performance as his manager and friend. The shoot-outs are wonderfully brutal, special mention to the end blaze of glory which is an almost tongue in cheek effigy to the high grossing action films of the 80s and a few classic samurai flicks.

The tone of the movie is set by a distinct quote.

"Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might." And this is exactly what Director 'Jesse Johnson' does with a great passion for action. On a reported budget of $500,000.00 (aka nowt!) he has deftly crafted a intriguing tale of brotherhood, vendetta and redemption through violence.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1150,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2008-05-23","keywords":"dog fighting,pit fighter,wrestling,wrestler,gangster","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888664/","name":"Dominiquie Vandenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000874/","name":"Steven Bauer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0140488/","name":"Fernando Carrillo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425364/","name":"Jesse V. Johnson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0119824/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425364/","name":"Jesse V. Johnson"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bone Eater
Zjadacz kości
Bone Eater
programme.desc:
Bone Eater: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Horse, Adoni Maropis, Clara Bryant. Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"trashgang"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"just to see all those old actors again from the B-genre","reviewBody":"1986 brought us Chopping Mall from director Jim Wynorski, a classic in the genre. This here, Bone Eater won't be remembered. It contains a lot of very cheap and bad CGI but it's worth watching for the old thespians to see.

I guess that the budget went to the casting in stead of the effects. Main lead is by Bruce Boxleitner (Tron legacy (1982 and 2010)), but there are others to recogniz, Willam Katt from House (1986), Walter Koenig (from the Star Trak saga as Chekov),Veronica Hamel from Hill Street Blues (1981-1987) and Jim Storm from Dark Shadows (1966). 

The story itself was rather okay and the acting was also okay but the CGI teared it into a funny flick. To give you an example of cheap effects, the earthquakes were done by shaky camera's and you could easily see that the trees weren't moving. 

If you want to see the old brigade again than this is surely one to watch as a starter on a horror night with your pals. But if you think it will be a scary flick, forget it.

Gore 0/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 0,5/5 Story 2/5 Comedy 0/5","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1227,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-02-09","keywords":"bone,worker,giant skeleton,relic,tomahawk","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000310/","name":"Bruce Boxleitner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395398/","name":"Michael Horse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549538/","name":"Adoni Maropis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486610/","name":"William Langlois"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Agent of Influence
programme.desc: Agent of Influence: Directed by Michel Poulette. With Christopher Plummer, Marina Orsini, Ted Whittall, Shaun Johnston. From Ian Adams' book of the same name, "Agent of Influence" is based on a real story of the intrigue surrounding the mysterious death of one of Canada's most accomplished foreign diplomats, John Watkins." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307934/","name":"Agent of Influence","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM2ZDMwYTgtNmM5Mi00NWI5LWExOTQtMzQ0YjI0YTA2ZDliXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk5MjAyMjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"From Ian Adams' book of the same name, "Agent of Influence" is based on a real story of the intrigue surrounding the mysterious death of one of Canada's most accomplished foreign diplomats, John Watkins.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0307934/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Uriah43"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Ambassador in a Compromised Position","reviewBody":"Loosely based on a true story, this film revolves around a man by the name of "John Watkins" (Christopher Plummer) who was a close and trusted friend of the Canadian Prime Minister. As such, he was given a position as the ambassador to the Soviet Union and from all accounts performed quite well. However, when some compromising information became available that implicated him in a possible blackmail scheme by the Soviets for a homosexual affair, he was quickly apprehended by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and interrogated. What follows in this film is a possible narrative of the events during his interrogation which have certain sinister overtones that may-or may not-be credible. Now, rather than reveal any more and risk potentially ruining the film for those who haven't seen it, I will just say that after reading the account of this incident it is quite possible that the events depicted in this movie are somewhat embellished to provide for a better story than would have been obtained otherwise. Regardless, as far as this picture is concerned, there really wasn't that much action or suspense but Christopher Plummer performed adequately enough to maintain my interest for the most part and because of that I have rated this film accordingly. Average.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":321,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"keywords":"cia central intelligence agency,cold war,espionage,canadian soviet relations,canadian russian relations","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001626/","name":"Christopher Plummer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0650739/","name":"Marina Orsini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926471/","name":"Ted Whittall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693599/","name":"Michel Poulette"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0231796/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005842/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160942/","name":"Ken Chubb"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011021/","name":"Ian Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1135065/","name":"Riley Adams"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="
